html:
Dec 23 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Amazon.com Inc's AMZN.O cloud-computing unit suffered a new outage on Wednesday, at least its third this month, spurring disruptions at other companies and underscoring how regional digital infrastructure problems can have far-reaching effects. https://on.wsj.com/3mtzujx


- U.S. health regulators cleared the use of a COVID-19 pill from Pfizer Inc PFE.N, the first drug that newly infected patients can now take at home to stay out of the hospital. https://on.wsj.com/33HIfzY


- Novavax Inc NVAX.O said its two-dose COVID-19 vaccine demonstrated "strong immune responses" against the Omicron variant and other variants of the coronavirus, citing initial data. https://on.wsj.com/3qiNJce


- Chinese gaming and social media company Tencent Holdings Ltd 0700.HK is shedding most of its stake in JD.com Inc 9618.HK, saying that the e-commerce company has grown to the point where it no longer requires Tencent's financial backing. https://on.wsj.com/3srwdoG


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
